Sentencas: In order to investigate the performance of Cu-Mn spinel coatings used for solid oxide fuel cell interconnect, a series of CuxMn3-xO4 (x = 0.6, 0.8, 1.0, 1.1, 1.2, and 1.3) coatings are prepared using supersonic spraying via subsequent sintering.
Titulo: Investigation of CuxMn3-xO4 coatings for solid oxide fuel cell interconnect applications

Sentencas: The chemical composition and distribution, lattice structures, morphology, and electrical properties are characterized by X-ray diffraction (XRD), scanning electron microscopy (SEM), energy-dispersive X-ray spectroscopy (EDS), and area-specific resistance (ASR) measurements.
Titulo: Investigation of CuxMn3-xO4 coatings for solid oxide fuel cell interconnect applications

Sentencas: The experimental results show that with the increase of Cu concentration in the coatings, the crystalline structure gradually changes from inverse spinel into normal spinel, especially when 0.6 < x < 1.0.
Titulo: Investigation of CuxMn3-xO4 coatings for solid oxide fuel cell interconnect applications

Sentencas: An improvement in electrical conductivity accompanies the crystalline structural transformation.
Titulo: Investigation of CuxMn3-xO4 coatings for solid oxide fuel cell interconnect applications

Sentencas: The coatings show high electrical conductivity when 1.0 < x < 1.3, especially from 600 to 800 & DEG;C. However, the scale (mainly Cr2O3) is reactive to the CuxMn3-xO4 coatings (especially when 1.1 < x < 1.3) at elevated temperatures.
Titulo: Investigation of CuxMn3-xO4 coatings for solid oxide fuel cell interconnect applications

Sentencas: During the long-term experiment, the reaction cor-rodes the coatings, consumes the materials in coatings and scale, and forms new phases (mainly (Cu,Mn,Cr)3O4 and (Cr,Mn)3O4).
Titulo: Investigation of CuxMn3-xO4 coatings for solid oxide fuel cell interconnect applications

Sentencas: This phenomenon (Cr-corrosion) aggravates the Cr diffusion, causes a quick increase of ASR, and weakens the oxidation resistance.
Titulo: Investigation of CuxMn3-xO4 coatings for solid oxide fuel cell interconnect applications

Sentencas: The adverse effects of Cr-corrosion can be alleviated by appropriately lowering the operating temperature.
Titulo: Investigation of CuxMn3-xO4 coatings for solid oxide fuel cell interconnect applications

Sentencas: Among the coatings, Cu1.0Mn2.0O4 exhibited good electrical conductivity and soundness against the Cr-corrosion and can be considered a competitive candidate for SOFC applications.
Titulo: Investigation of CuxMn3-xO4 coatings for solid oxide fuel cell interconnect applications
